user_request: Write a poem about a traveler at a fork in a yellow wood who chooses the less-traveled path.
final_poem:
A traveler stood, amidst the golden glow
Of sun-kissed trees that stretched towards the sky
Two roads converged before him to and fro
A choice awaited him, of path or nigh

He weighed the options with an uncertain mind
The well-trodden road a safer route it seemed
But something whispered in his troubled heart's design
To take the lesser path, where wild things gleam

With hesitance he stepped onto the unexplored way
Leaving behind the worn and winding course
Of familiar feet that trod this path by day
He chose instead to venture into the obscure force
